publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4163 Stuart McMillan: Prison to be Named Low Moss—That the Parliament welcomes the news from the Scottish Prison Service that the new prison being built in East Dunbartonshire will keep the name, HMP Low Moss; notes the concerted campaign by members of the public who were against the working title, HMP Bishopbriggs, as the name for the new prison from the outset, and acknowledges that common sense has prevailed in the naming of the new prison. Supported by: Christina McKelvie*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*, Bob Doris*, Stewart Maxwell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Gil Paterson*, Ian McKee*, Brian Adam*
S3M-4163 Prison to be Named Low Moss (lodged on 18 May 2009) John Wilson*, Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-4163 Stuart McMillan: Prison to be Named Low Moss—That the Parliament welcomes the news from the Scottish Prison Service that the new prison being built in East Dunbartonshire will keep the name, HMP Low Moss; notes the concerted campaign by members of the public who were against the working title, HMP Bishopbriggs, as the name for the new prison from the outset, and acknowledges that common sense has prevailed in the naming of the new prison. Supported by: Christina McKelvie, Sandra White, Bill Kidd, Robin Harper, Bob Doris, Stewart Maxwell, Kenneth Gibson, Gil Paterson, Ian McKee, Brian Adam, John Wilson, Jamie Hepburn
